node.title: Defence allowed to vet evidence presented to inquiry into bushfire accidentally sparked by its own helicopter
node.alt: An aerial photograph of a spreading patch of fire in bushland, with masses of smoke rising from the fire.
node.description: An ACT coroner has allowed a suppression order on the brief of evidence presented to a bushfire inquiry, soÂ the Department of Defence can determine if there are any security issues.
node.content:
["The Department of Defence will be allowed to vet evidence presented to a coronial inquiry into the ACT's Orroral Valley bushfire, ahead of formal court hearings in July next year.", "Coroner Lorraine Walker is looking into the 45 minutes between when an Australian Army helicopter accidentally sparked the fire and when ACT authorities were made aware of the fire's location, with a particular emphasis on roles and communications.", "\"The reason I [called]\u00a0this inquiry was the apparent lack of information about a particular period of time,\" she told the inquest today.", "The issue\u00a0came to light when documents obtained by the ABC revealed the crew of the Australian Army helicopter that inadvertently sparked the blaze did not pass on crucial details about the fire's location to authorities for 45 minutes.", "The ABC\u00a0also revealed those aboard the helicopter had taken pictures of the flames as they left the area.", "By the time firefighters were alerted to the fire's exact location, it\u00a0had turned into a significant blaze, which went on to burn for a month in the Namadgi National Park and eventually\u00a0cross the border\u00a0into NSW, where it destroyed homes.", "
Defence denied\u00a0internal interviewer
", "", "
The Orroral Valley bushfire, which began in Namadgi National Park, spread across the NSW border and destroyed homes.(ABC: Greg Nelson)
", "Today Kylie Nomchong, who is assisting the coroner, told the court there had been a significant loss of flora, fauna and infrastructure in the park.", "She said the inquiry would look into the circumstances of an operation involving Defence, ACT Parks and Conservation Services and the ACT's Emergency Services Agency being conducted that day.", "The inquest heard three Australian Federal Police officers had been appointed to interview those involved.", "Lawyer for the Defence Department, Michael Fordham, suggested that could be done by the department itself, but this was rejected by Coroner Walker.", "\"My preference would be to have my appointed investigators do the interviews,\" she said.", "\"Otherwise they will be subpoenaed and will have to answer questions in the dock.\"", "Mr Fordham told the court the witnesses were spread around the world \u2014 from New Zealand to the USA and in Queensland.", "Coroner Walker said some interviews would have to be conducted by video link.", "", "
Residents in the NSW town of Bumbalong lost their homes in the Clear Range fire, which was linked to the Orroral Valley blaze.(ABC News: Michael Inman)
", "But the court has allowed a suppression order on the brief of evidence until the Department of Defence can determine if there are any security issues.", "The court has also been asked to consider if a group of residents from Bumbalong in New South Wales should be allowed to join the inquest.", "The group was affected by the Clear Range fire which was linked to the Orroral Valley fire.", "Coroner Walker had previously confined her inquiry to the ACT border, but is considering the request.", "The formal hearings will begin next July."]
